class.name: mv-autoedit
class.purpose: Mavo root	Mavo will start in edit mode (no need to click the Edit button). Useful for apps that are almost always in edit mode, but still need a read mode (if read mode is not needed at all, use `mv-mode` instead).

class.name: mv-fixed
class.purpose: Style the toolbar as fixed at the top of the screen (always visible).

class.name: mv-logged-in
class.purpose: Only show element to logged in users.

class.name: mv-logged-out
class.purpose: Only show element to logged out users.

coreAttribute.name: mv-app
coreAttribute.purpose: Allows you to assign an id to your app, which is used in a number of places. The element with this attribute is called the **Mavo root**.

coreAttribute.name: property
coreAttribute.purpose: Names elements that will be saved, edited, or used in [expressions](/docs/expressions). Elements with this attribute are called **Properties**.

coreAttribute.name: mv-storage
coreAttribute.purpose: Tells Mavo where data is stored. It’s used on the Mavo root with any of the accepted values or optionally on individual properties to prevent them from being stored (`mv-storage="none"`).

coreAttribute.name: typeof
coreAttribute.purpose: The value of this property element is not just an attribute or its text content, but the union of the values of the properties inside it. This is almost always inferred from the structure of your properties and added automatically, but you can use it to force an element to be a group, or to declare the type of the group (e.g. `typeof="Person"`) for better semantic value. Elements with this attribute are called **groups**, objects, or complex properties.

coreAttribute.name: mv-multiple
coreAttribute.purpose: Makes elements repeatable. Only has meaning on property elements, if there is no `property` attribute, one will be added automatically with a generated name like "collection". Elements with this attribute are called **Collections**.

attribute.name: mv-attribute
attribute.purpose: Override the defaults for which attribute holds the data for this element. For no attribute (element content), specify `"none"`.

attribute.name: mv-action
attribute.purpose: Run an action that modifies the data when an element is clicked or a form is submitted.

attribute.name: mv-source
attribute.purpose: If specified, it is used instead of `mv-storage` for loading data. Useful when you want to read from one location and write to a different location. Same values as `mv-storage`.

attribute.name: mv-init
attribute.purpose: If no data is stored, `mv-init` will be used to load initial data. Same values as `mv-storage`.

attribute.name: mv-default
attribute.purpose: Sets the default value. If no value, the default value becomes the property content.

attribute.name: mv-order
attribute.purpose: Values: `desc` or `asc`. Controls the order that new items are added to collections.

attribute.name: mv-expressions
attribute.purpose: Change the expression syntax or disable [expressions](/docs/expressions) altogether.

attribute.name: mv-expressions-ignore
attribute.purpose: Disable expressions on specific attributes

attribute.name: mv-value
attribute.purpose: Set an element's content to the result of an [expressions](/docs/expressions/#providing-fallbacks-the-mv-value-attribute).

attribute.name: mv-if
attribute.purpose: Remove an element from the DOM if the expression doesn't match and re-add it when it does.

attribute.name: mv-accepts
attribute.purpose: Property names (space separated) of other collections that can move items to this one.

attribute.name: mv-edit
attribute.purpose: Customize how an element is edited by linking to another element, anywhere in the page.

attribute.name: mv-edit-*
attribute.purpose: Any attributes set this way will be copied over to the property's editor.

attribute.name: mv-mode
attribute.purpose: Control whether a property is in read or edit mode independently of the mode of the rest of the Mavo app.

attribute.name: mv-format
attribute.purpose: Render and edit only a subset of the remote data, by providing a (slash-separated) path to the data it handles.

attribute.name: mv-autosave
attribute.purpose: Save automatically when the data changes, either immediately or at most every N seconds.

attribute.name: mv-bar
attribute.purpose: Control which buttons may appear in the toolbar and in what order, or hide the toolbar completely.

attribute.name: mv-path
attribute.purpose: Render and edit only a subset of the stored data.

attribute.name: mv-multiple-path
attribute.purpose: Same as `mv-path` but applies to the collection itself, not the item(s).

attribute.name: mv-alias
attribute.purpose: If provided, Mavo will read data from this property **instead** of its real property name. Useful to read stored data properly after renaming a property in the HTML.

attribute.name: mv-initial-items
attribute.purpose: How many items should the collection start with? If not provided, it is 1, unless `mv-like` is also specified, in which case it's 0 (to prevent infinite recursion).

attribute.name: mv-uploads
attribute.purpose: Sets the local path for uploads. Mandatory to enable uploads on `<a>` and `<link>`.

attribute.name: mv-upload-url
attribute.purpose: Sets the URL for serving uploaded resources from.

attribute.name: aria-label
attribute.purpose: Sets or contains the label the property will use during editing.

generatedAttribute.name: mv-progress
generatedAttribute.purpose: Only set when an event is in progress. Its value reflects what event, e.g. `"Saving"` or `"Loading"`.

generatedAttribute.name: mv-clicked
generatedAttribute.on: Properties that are `<button>` elements or have a `counter` class.
generatedAttribute.purpose: The number of times the button has been clicked.

generatedAttribute.name: mv-permissions
generatedAttribute.purpose: Space-separated list of permissions (read, edit, add, delete, login, logout, save)

generatedAttribute.name: mv-mode
generatedAttribute.purpose: `mv-mode="edit"` is applied on every property when it’s being edited.

generatedClass.name: mv-target-within
generatedClass.on: Any element that matches the CSS `:target` pseudo-class or contains an element that does.

generatedClass.name: mv-ui
generatedClass.on: Any (usually generated) controls for triggering Mavo-related actions

generatedClass.name: mv-deleted
generatedClass.on: Collection items that have been deleted but the deletion is not yet saved

generatedClass.name: mv-item-bar
generatedClass.on: Buttons on collection items for deleting, adding, rearranging.

generatedClass.name: mv-highlight
generatedClass.on: Highlighted collection items (e.g. when hovering over the delete button)

generatedClass.name: mv-editor
generatedClass.on: Element used for editing a property

generatedClass.name: mv-popup
generatedClass.on: Generated popup for editing an attribute.

cssVariable.name: --mv-loader
cssVariable.value: data URI of Mavo loader (the three animated dots)

cssVariable.name: --mv-rubbish-bin
cssVariable.value: data URI of Mavo rubbish bin icon
